course_main_structural_unit.address:
Riia 23b, ruumid 301-305, 328, 329
51010 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
1.	Evidence for Evolution; Evolutionary Biology and the Society
2.	The History of Evolutionary Biology
3.	The Origin of Life
4.	The Last Universal Common Ancestor and the Tree of Life
5.	Evolutionary Biology and Genetics
6.	Diversification of Bacteria and Archaea. I: Phylogeny and Biology
7.	Diversification of Bacteria and Archaea. II: Genetics and Genomics
8.	The Origin and Diversification of Eukaryotes
9.	Multicellularity and Development
10.	Evolution of Developmental Programs
11.	Diversification of Plants and Animals
12.	Evolutionary History of Primates, incl. Hominins; Human Population Genetics
13.	Biogeography
14.	Species Concept & Speciation
description.et:
1.	Evolutsiooni tõendid; evolutsioonibioloogia ja ühiskond
2.	Evolutsioonibioloogia ajalugu
3.	Elu teke
4.	Viimane ühine esivanem ja elu puu
5.	Evolutsioonibioloogia ja geneetika
6.	Bakterite ja arhede mitmekesistumine I: fülogenees ja bioloogia
7.	Bakterite ja arhede mitmekesistumine II: geneetika ja genoomika
8.	Eukarüootide teke ja mitmekesistumine
9.	Hulkraksus ja areng
10.	Arengubioloogiliste programmide evolutsioon
11.	Taimede ja loomade mitmekesistumine
12.	Primaatide, sh hominiinide evolutsioon; inimese populatsioonigeneetika
13.	Biogeograafia
14.	Liigi mõiste ja liigiteke

objectives.en: The goal is to develop a view of the Natural World as a system where evolution is the key making comprehension possible in principle.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on arendada arusaamist elusloodusest kui süsteemist, mille mõistmise võtmeks on evolutsioon.

learning_outcomes.en: The students will have basic knowledge about evolution and the evolutionary history of major groups of organisms.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilased omandavad baasteadmised evolutsioonist ja põhiliste organismirühmade evolutsioonilisest kujunemisest.

description.et:
The final grade will be made up of two parts:
60% the result of the written exam
40% individual (online quiz) and group work (presentation based on a scientific article on evolution) during the course

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade will be made up of two parts:
60% the result of the written exam
40% individual (online quiz) and group work (presentation based on a scientific article on evolution) during the course

debt_elimination.et: Must be discussed and agreed upon with the lecturers in each case.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
N.H. Barton, D.E.G. Briggs, J.A. Eisen, D.B. Goldstein, N.H. Patel "Evolution" (2007)
C.T. Bergstrom, L.A. Dugatkin "Evolution" (2nd Edition, 2016)

description.et: Introduction to the course, organisational questions. Evidence for evolution, evolutionary biology and the society (Mait Metspalu)
Student discussion "Perception of evolution in my country" (Mait Metspalu)
History of evolutionary biology I (Mait Metspalu)
History of evolutionary biology II (Mait Metspalu)
Exercises in genetics and evolutionary biology (Mari Järve)
Genetics and evolutionary biology (Mari Järve)
Evolution of bacteria and archaea I (Mari Järve)
Evolution of bacteria and archaea II (Mari Järve)
Eukaryote evolution (Mari Järve)
Evolution of multicellularity (Mari Järve)
Online quiz on the course so far (Mari Järve)
Evolution of developmental programs (Mari Järve)
Macroevolution (Mari Järve)
Diversification of plants and animals (Mari Järve)
Evolution of primates, incl hominins (Kristiina Tambets)
Biogeography (Kristiina Tambets)
Origin of life, the last universal common ancestor, the tree of life (Monika Karmin)
Group presentations I (Burak Yelmen)
Group presentations II (Burak Yelmen)
Human population genetics (Mait Metspalu)
Species concept, speciation (Mait Metspalu)
Course summary, revision for the exam, student feedback (Mait Metspalu, Mari Järve)
